entries.excerpt: Humans are capable of atrocious cruelty – the history of war makes this all too clear. How many died in war? And what are the prospects for making the world more peaceful?
entries.kpi: • Over the last decade the annual number of battle-related deaths was 55,000 globally.

entries.title: Military Spending
entries.excerpt: How much do different countries spent on their military? How did it change over time?
entries.kpi: • Annual military spending amounts to 2.2% of global GDP.

entries.title: Terrorism
entries.excerpt: The attacks of terrorists receive a lot of attention from the media and often dominate the public discourse. How many people die from these attacks and how did it change over time?
entries.kpi: • Over the last decade the annual number of deaths due to terrorism was 22,000 globally.

entries.title: Nuclear Weapons
entries.excerpt: The world’s nuclear powers possess in total 10,145 nuclear warheads. These weapons have the capacity to kill hundreds of millions of people directly, and billions due to subsequent effects on agriculture.
entries.kpi: The world’s nuclear powers have more than 10,000 nuclear warheads.

entries.title: Peacekeeping
entries.excerpt: Peacekeeping aims to help countries transition from conflict towards peace. How have peacekeeping operations and forces changed over time? See global data on peacekeeping activities.
entries.kpi: Peacekeeping operations are used in conflict prevention, but are not always successful.

entries.title: Genocides
entries.excerpt: The organized killings targeted at particular groups for their ethnicity, religion or political belief killed many millions.
entries.kpi: Targeted killing of specific societal groups have killed millions.
